entries.meaning: (mining) Money, materials, tools, food etc. provided to a prospector in return for a share in future profits.
(business) An amount of money advanced to someone starting a business in return for a share of the future profits.
Money, necessities stockpiled to sustain an effort for a period of time.
examples: No one however should go to this country intending to mine without taking with him a year's supplies commonly known as a grub stake or its money equivalent about $1,000.

verbs.description: grubstake (third-person singular simple present grubstakes, present participle grubstaking, simple past and past participle grubstaked)

examples: "Nobody grub-stakes me," was the answer. "I stake myself, and when I make a killing it's sure all mine. [...] "
